intro: Stachygynandrum rubricaule var. angolense, commonly known as the Angola red-flowered stachygynandrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. This variant is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers, which are often clustered in racemes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features include lanceolate leaves and a rhizomatous root system, which aid in its survival in humid conditions.
